==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{liushu|ic}} : A needle {{zh-l|*䇂}} (abbreviated to {{zh-l|*立}}) going through a slave's eye. In ancient China, slaves were blinded. Compare {{zh-l|*民}}.

It is also possible that it is a {{Han compound|立|重|c1=s|c2=p|ls=psc|nocap=y}}. The bottom component is unrelated to {{zh-l|*里}}.

Original meaning was “boy servant”.
